channel.title: How to add and remove NpcDrops on (runescource)? (SOLVED)
channel.description: I've tried many different things to find how to change npc drops on runesource but i cant find how to do it, anyone out there with experience with runesouce help me? thanks.

item.title: How to add and remove NpcDrops on (runescource)? (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @kbpapango kbpapango
item.description:
@kbpapango wrote:

braxton899:

still don’t understand how to change a certain npc, lets say i want lumbride goblins drops to change, how would i go about doing something like that?

If u dont want to Add drop editor change it manually source>data>npcs>UNPACKEDDROPS

SAMPLE

8133 is CORP npc ID

	<item>13752</item>   [b]13752  is Spectral sigil item ID[/b] 
	<rate>6.0</rate>       [b]6.0 is items percentage drop[/b]
	<minamount>1<minamount>            [b]1 how many will be drop[/b]
	<maxamount>1</maxamount>          [b]1 maximum amount of sigil will dro[/b]p

so if u want to change lumbridge goblins drops search the goblins npc id then change the items/rate/amounts
if u still dont get it, go and play basketball

Read full topic

item.source: How to add and remove NpcDrops on (runescource)? (SOLVED)

item.title: How to add and remove NpcDrops on (runescource)? (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @sorecheeny sorecheeny
item.description:
@sorecheeny wrote:

You’re gonna want to find your npcDrops.xml.

This is located in
".Data/npcs".

Once you’re in there, open it in eclipse.

An example of an npc drop is this:

	<dropController>
	  <npcIds>
		<int>1</int>
	  </npcIds>
	  <drops>
	     <npcDrop>
	       <id>995</id>
	       <count>
	         <int>46</int>
	       </count>
	       <chance>1</chance>
	     </npcDrop>
	  </drops>
	</dropController>

starts the NPC drop.


1
 Declares the npcId that you’re going to make the drop for, and the 1 stands for the npc ID
ends the npcIds statement



Starts drops.

995 The first npcdrop in its db


46
the amount of the item (995) that will be dropped.

1 Rarity of the item getting dropped (see chance values below)



Finishes the drop.

Chance values

[code]
Chance - 1: Always will get the item

Chance - 2: Common

Chance - 3: Uncommon

Chance - 4: Rare

Chance - 5: Very rare[/code]

This is the knowledge that I have on NPC drops, if I’m wrong someone correct me.

Read full topic
